Struggle of Korean People Supported in Uganda
articles.content:
Struggle of Korean People Supported in Uganda 
    Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A statement was issued by the Secretariat of the National Movement of Uganda on June 2 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
 The statement said the joint declaration called on the north and the south of Korea to put the common interests of the nation above anything else, urging the U.S. to take hands off Korea and stop its nuclear row against the DPRK.    
 It voiced support to the Korean people in their struggle to achieve national reunification free from foreign interference in the spirit of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.

10th Meeting of Separated Families and Relatives Expected
articles.content:
10th Meeting of Separated Families and Relatives Expected 
    Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The 10th meeting of separated families and relatives will be held at Mt. Kumgang resort between July 11 and 16.
 Jang Jae On, chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society, and Ri Yun Gu, president of the south Korean Red Cross, agreed upon this in Pyongyang Monday after sincerely discussing issues raised by the two sides.    
 It was agreed to discuss business-like matters through contact between Red Cross liaison representatives at Panmunjom.

Congratulatory Message to Prime Minister of Nepal
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Prime Minister of Nepal
    Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Sher Bahadur Deuba upon his appointment as prime minister of the Kingdom of Nepal.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work.

Del. of Int'l Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies Leaves
articles.content:
Del. of Int'l Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies Leaves
    Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies led by General Secretary Markku Niskala left here Tuesday.
 It was seen off at the airport by officials concerned and the head of the aid delegation of the federation working in the DPRK.    
 During its stay the delegation went round the affected area of Ryongchon County, North Phyongan Province, and some aiding objects in Sunchon City, South Phyongan Province.
